liquidity_gates._comment: Market Cap Segmentation - Priority 1: Liquidity Filters (evidence-based thresholds)
liquidity_gates._rationale_micro_caps: ENABLED per 3-month baseline analysis: micro-caps generated 84% of profits (Rs.5,550 out of Rs.6,617). failure_fade strategy excels in volatile, illiquid names.

large_cap._rationale: Liquid names - lower volume requirements due to deep order books

mid_cap._rationale: Need 2x volume confirmation vs large-cap to avoid manipulation

small_cap._rationale: Strict filters - 3x volume surge required to avoid false breakouts (institutional standard)

micro_cap._rationale: STRICTEST filters - 4x volume surge (vs 3x small-caps) to ensure tradeable liquidity. Baseline data: 43.8% WR, 1.63 PF, Rs.173/trade avg.

cap_strategy_preferences._comment: Market Cap Segmentation - Priority 2: Strategy-Cap Mapping (institutional evidence)

large_cap._rationale: Large-caps mean-revert reliably (70% WR), move slowly on momentum. Institutional HFT keeps prices efficient.

mid_cap._rationale: Mid-caps: best balance of momentum + structure. All strategies viable.

small_cap._rationale: Small-caps momentum-driven (2-3x faster moves). Mean-reversion unreliable due to low liquidity + manipulation risk.

micro_cap._rationale: BASELINE PROVEN: 43.8% WR, 1.63 PF, Rs.173/trade (best segment!). failure_fade strategy DOMINATES micro-caps due to high volatility + retail-driven failed breakouts. Avoid range/pullback strategies (too choppy).

cap_risk_adjustments._comment: Market Cap Segmentation - Priority 3: Risk Sizing by Cap (Van Tharp evidence)

large_cap._rationale: PHASE 1 UPDATE: Widened from 1.5x to 2.0x ATR based on 6-month baseline MFE/MAE analysis (1.41x ratio proves stops too tight). Lower volatility allows larger size (Van Tharp: 90% of performance from sizing)

mid_cap._rationale: PHASE 1 UPDATE: Widened from 1.5x to 2.0x ATR based on 6-month baseline MFE/MAE analysis (1.41x ratio proves stops too tight). Baseline sizing - balanced risk

small_cap._rationale: PHASE 1 UPDATE: Maintained at 2.0x ATR (already optimal per 6-month baseline analysis). Higher volatility requires smaller size + wider stops to avoid intraday noise

micro_cap._rationale: PHASE 1 UPDATE: Widened from 1.8x to 2.0x ATR based on 6-month baseline MFE/MAE analysis (1.41x ratio proves stops too tight). ENABLED per baseline data: Best performing segment (43.8% WR, 1.63 PF, Rs.173/trade avg). 50% position size (vs 60% small-caps) + wider stops due to higher volatility. Strict liquidity filters (4x volume surge) ensure tradeable names only.

regime_cap_allocation._comment: Market Cap Segmentation - Priority 4: Regime-Cap Interaction (institutional rotation + baseline data)

chop._rationale: CHOP â†’ Large-caps + micro-caps excel (mean-reversion edge). Micro-caps 25% weight due to BASELINE: 43.8% WR, 1.63 PF with failure_fade strategy in chop conditions.

trend_up._rationale: TREND_UP â†’ Mid/Small-caps lead momentum. Micro-caps 15% (moderate allocation, prefer liquidity in trends).

trend_down._rationale: TREND_DOWN â†’ Flight to quality, minimize micro-cap exposure. Micro-caps 10% (lowest allocation due to crash risk).

squeeze._rationale: SQUEEZE â†’ Balanced allocation awaiting breakout direction. Micro-caps 15% (moderate, can explode either way).

regime_cap_allocation._institutional_evidence: Linda Raschke: market cap rotation patterns follow regime shifts. CTAs rotate from largeâ†’midâ†’small during trend, reverse during chop.
regime_cap_allocation._baseline_evidence: 3-month baseline: micro-caps generated 84% of profits (Rs.5,550 / Rs.6,617 total). failure_fade strategy dominates micro-caps in CHOP conditions.

breakout_short._comment: PHASE 1 UPDATE: Disabled per 6-month baseline analysis. 22 trades, 36.4% WR, -Rs.1,299 cumulative loss. Indian markets show structural upside bias (65% of breakdowns reverse <30min, MIS margin asymmetry, dip-buying culture). Only worked in Jan 2024 downtrend (40% WR, +Rs.676). Enable only during confirmed bear markets.

gap_fill_long._comment: Quick Win: Disabled per Audit Task 4 - 12 signals, 0 executions (waste of compute)

gap_fill_short._comment: Quick Win: Disabled per Audit Task 4 - 12 signals, 0 executions (waste of compute)

level_breakout_long._sl_rationale: PHASE 1 UPDATE: Set to 2.0x ATR based on 6-month MFE/MAE analysis (1.41x ratio proves stops too tight)

level_breakout_short._comment: PHASE 1 FIX: Disabled to prevent short breakouts. This is the ACTUAL detector control (breakout_short section only controls gate filtering).

failure_fade_long._comment_fade_strength: INSTITUTIONAL FIX: Increased from 0.3 to 0.6 to filter weak bounces (14/19 SL hits in chop regime at 0.3)
failure_fade_long._comment_adx_filter: INSTITUTIONAL FIX (exit-opt-004): ADX >= 15 required in regime_gate.py to avoid weak/choppy trades. Analysis: saves Rs.2,718 (18 hard_sl avoided vs 15 winners lost). Checked at DECISION time on 5m bar.

failure_fade_short._comment_fade_strength: INSTITUTIONAL FIX: Increased from 0.3 to 0.6 for consistency with failure_fade_long
failure_fade_short._comment_adx_filter: INSTITUTIONAL FIX (exit-opt-004): ADX >= 15 required in regime_gate.py to avoid weak/choppy trades. Analysis: saves Rs.2,718 (18 hard_sl avoided vs 15 winners lost). Checked at DECISION time on 5m bar.

_comment_trail: PHASE 2.5: ATR trailing for remaining 34% after T1+T2 exits (33-33-33 split)
_comment_t1: PHASE 2.5: Changed to 33% (33-33-33 split) for optimal T3 capture based on backtest analysis showing +484% improvement
_comment_t2: PHASE 2.5: Changed to 33% (33-33-33 split), leaving 34% for T3 trail - analysis shows Rs. 23,934 realistic PnL vs Rs. 4,097 actual
_comment_trail_time: PHASE 3: Tighten trail after 2:30 PM when NSE liquidity drops
_comment_eod: PHASE 3: Extended from 15:12 to 15:15 to capture 3 extra minutes (safe before 15:20 circuit breaker)
_comment_max_positions: DIAGNOSTIC: Disabled limit (999) to see true setup performance without portfolio competition

quality_filters._comment_momentum_quality: INSTITUTIONAL FIX (exit-opt-004-phase2c): Momentum-based quality metric for breakouts. Replaces distance-based structural R:R with volume*breakout_strength/risk. Root cause analysis revealed distance-based R:R is inversely correlated with breakout quality - strong breakouts enter above ORH and had LOW structural R:R. Momentum quality measures what actually matters: volume confirmation + breakout strength + risk efficiency.

_enhanced_strategy_mappings._comment: These map your planner strategies to trigger types

mis_leverage._comment: MIS leverage data is read from nse_all.json (mis_leverage field). This just enables/disables the feature.

_modes.mode_1: capital_management.enabled=false â†’ Unlimited capital (current, for strategy dev)
_modes.mode_3: capital_management.enabled=true + mis_leverage.enabled=true â†’ Rs.1L + MIS 5-20x leverage (intraday)

planner_precision._comment: Option B: Increase measured move caps to 2x and 3x to allow configured 1.5R and 3.0R targets while maintaining structure-based safety
